trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> class represents an application partition for a particular domain.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> class, using the specified distinguished name.
The default object class that represents the application partition is domainDNS.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext"></xref> object that is used to create this application partition.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the distinguished name for this application partition.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target server is either busy or unavailable.
The target in the context parameter is not a server, or the distinguishedName parameter is not in a valid distinguished name format.
context or distinguishedName is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> class, using the specified distinguished name and object class.
The default object class that represents the application partition is domainDNS.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext"></xref> object that is used to create this application partition.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the distinguished name for this application partition.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the object class that represents this application partition.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target server is either busy or unavailable.
The target in the context parameter is not a server, or the distinguishedName parameter is not in a valid distinguished name format.

This exception is also thrown if the application partition is being created within an Active Directory forest, rather than an AD LDS configuration set, because the objectClass can only be specified for AD LDS configuration sets.
context or distinguishedName is `null`.
Deletes this application partition.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object has not yet been saved in the underlying directory store.
The object has been disposed.
Gets an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServerCollection"></xref> object that contains the directory servers that host this application partition.

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition.DirectoryServers%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property returns the same collection of <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer> objects as the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition.FindAllDirectoryServers?displayProperty=fullName> method if the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition> object has been committed to the underlying directory services store.

A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServerCollection"></xref> object that contains <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer"></xref> objects that represent directory servers for this application partition.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.
The object has been disposed.
Releases the managed resources that are used by the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object and optionally releases unmanaged resources.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that determines if the managed resources should be released.
`true` if the managed resources should be released; `false` if only the unmanaged resources should be released.
Returns a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection"></xref> object that contains all of the directory servers that host this application partition.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection"></xref> object that contains all of the directory servers that host this application partition.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.
The object has been disposed.

Returns an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection"></xref> object that contains all of the directory servers that host this application partition in the specified site.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the name of the site to search.

An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection"></xref> object that contains the directory servers that host this application partition in the specified site.
siteName is `null`.
siteName is an empty string.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.
The object has been disposed.

Returns a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection"></xref> object that contains all of the directory servers that have registered a site-specific DNS record, for the specified site, for the application partition.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the name of the site to search.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection"></xref> object that contains the directory servers that are found.
siteName is an empty string.
siteName is `null`.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.
The application partition is an AD LDS application partition.
The object has been disposed.

Returns a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection"></xref> object that contains all of the directory servers that have registered either a site-specific DNS record for the current site or a non-site-specific DNS record for the application partition.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection"></xref> object that contains the directory servers that were found.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.
The application partition is an AD LDS application partition.
The object has been disposed.

Returns an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object for a given <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext"></xref> object and distinguished name.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext"></xref> object that contains the target and credentials to use for the search.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the distinguished name of the application partition to search for.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object that represents the results of the search.
This exception will occur for any one of the following reasons:
A target specified in the context parameter could not be found.
The target is a configuration set and no AD LDS instance was found in that configuration set.
The target is a forest and the application partition was not found in that forest.
The target does not host the current application partition.
No AD LDS instance was found for the application partition.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
context or distinguishedName is `null`.
This exception will occur for any of the following reasons:
The context parameter is not a valid forest, configuration set, or directory server.
The distinguishedName has a zero length
The distinguishedName parameter is in an invalid format.
Returns a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer"></xref> object for this application partition and current site.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer"></xref> object for this application partition and site.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.
The object has been disposed.
Returns a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer"></xref> object for the application partition and current site with an option to ignore cached information.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that indicates whether cached information should be ignored.
`true` if cached information should be ignored; otherwise, `false`.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer"></xref> object for this application partition and site.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.
The object has been disposed.
Returns a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer"></xref> object for the application partition and a specified site.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies a site name.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer"></xref> object for this application partition and specified site.
siteName is an empty string.
siteName is `null`.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.
The object has been disposed.
Returns a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer"></xref> object for this application partition for a specified site, with an option to ignore cached information.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies a site name.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that indicates whether cached information should be ignored.
`true` if cached information should be ignored; otherwise, `false`.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer"></xref> object for this application partition and specified site.
siteName is an empty string.
siteName is `null`.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.
The object has been disposed.
Returns an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object for a specified directory context.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext"></xref> object that contains the target and credentials to use to retrieve the application partition object.
The directory context must specify the DNS name of the application partition.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object that represents the application partition for the specified directory context.
A target specified in context could not be found.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
context is `null`.
context is not valid.
Gets a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry"></xref> object for this application partition.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry"></xref> for this application partition.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object has not yet been saved in the Active Directory Domain Services store.
The object has been disposed.
Commits all changes to the current application partition object to the underlying directory store.
An application partition with the same name already exists.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target server is either busy or unavailable.
The object has been disposed.
Gets and sets the security reference domain for this application partition.
The distinguished name of the security reference domain for this application.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target server is either busy or unavailable.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition"></xref> object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store (applies to set only).
The application partition is an AD LDS application partition.
The object has been disposed.
